What is the capital of France?: Describe the process of photosynthesis in plants.
Photosynthesis is the process by which green plants and some other organisms convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose (a form of sugar) and oxygen using sunlight as the source of energy. This process takes place in the chloroplasts of plant cells.

What is the capital of France?: What is the role of mitochondria in a cell?
Mitochondria are membrane-bound organelles within cells that are often referred to as the "powerhouses" because they generate most of the cell's supply of adenosine triphosphate (ATP)
column3: which is the primary source of energy for cellular processes.
